meanings.definition: To cut with small, quick strokes.
meanings.sent1: I will snip the paper carefully.
meanings.sent2: She likes to snip coupons for discounts.
meanings.sent3: The tailor had to snip a little too much off the pants!
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to snip away at his confidence.
meanings.sent5: The chef's precise snip of the herbs added the perfect flavor to the dish.

meanings.definition: A small piece that has been cut off.
meanings.sent1: He found a snip of fabric on the floor.
meanings.sent2: The snip of hair fell to the ground.
meanings.sent3: The little girl proudly showed off her snip of ribbon.
meanings.sent4: The snip of cake disappeared in seconds.
meanings.sent5: The snip of paper was too small to use for the project.

meanings.sent1: The snip of the scissors echoed in the room.
meanings.sent2: She heard a snip in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The snip of the twig startled the bird.
meanings.sent4: The snip of the wire made her jump.
meanings.sent5: The snip of the thread signaled the end of the sewing project.
